page.title: 19HIGHLAND FOLK MUSEUM (5)
page.content: 1985 was also the{Girl Guide {Association Fiftieth Anniversary.} Two hundred Brownies and Girl Guides from the Badenoch and Strathspey Division came to the Museum on 21st June to ccelebrate. Games and guiding activities were organised. The{First {Aid}tent was staffed by a volunteer in nursing uniform of fifty years ago. The{latrines,}dug especially for the occasion and probably considered all that was necessary fifty years ago were avoided by our Brownies of today! The Portocabin toilet block was more in keeping with the expetations of Guiding in 1985. The successful day was drawn to a close after{Taps was sung,}flags lowered and lots of little Brownies and happy Girl Guides despatched home by bus, some facing a journey home of thirty miles.
